discourse_list.title: Endgame sceptics call today at 2pm ET / 8pm CET

content.content: Today during the Endgame call happening at 2pm ET / 8pm CET, the focus will be on giving a platform to MKR holders who are Endgame sceptics and who want to ask questions or have specific changes they would like to see made to the MIPs or the long term direction of the plan. The input from this call can either be turned into CVCs that organize within the long term boundaries of the Maker Constitution, or be turned into MIP102 edit proposals to the Maker Constitution or the Scope Frameworks that can make more impactful changes in the short run. Link to join the call: Launch Meeting - Zoom The call is open for everyone to join, ask questions etc, just like all the other Endgame calls, but the intention is to prioritize regular MKR holders so they have a chance to get heard.
content.GPT-summary: The post announces an Endgame call where MKR holders who are sceptical about the plan can ask questions or suggest changes. The input from the call can be turned into CVCs or MIP102 edit proposals. The call is open for everyone to join, but regular MKR holders are prioritized.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Notes I had going into the meeting. Voter Committee Meetings (covered in meeting)  Maybe not the right person to make this point, haven’t been present. Don’t seem to have involved much debate, back-and-forth, discussion, etc. Usually we trial things before ratifying them. DVCs-as-a-trial haven’t really been what they were planned to be. How can we avoid the same outcome for CVC meetings?  Suggest structures in advance? Ensure they have clear agendas?    Reputation/Numbers/Adoption  (covered in meeting)  Many roles in Endgame are ‘fire-walled’ and participants in one cannot take part in another. Maker’s reputation might be at an all time low with much of the ecosystem. Even aside from recent bad press, generally speaking, it’s never had a great reputation, or put much effort into changing that. I’m not sure we should be confident that we’ll have enough skilled applicants for all of the positions that are required by the endgame structure. I’m not sure we should be confident that subDAO tokens will be worthwhile to keep given the lack of reputation and confidence held by Maker. To rectify, we should perhaps start:  Producing value for the wider ecosystem where appropriate. Begin working more actively with other members of the ecosystem. Defining and Publicizing roles more actively.    EtherDAI  Is EtherDAI still a thing? If so, how will EtherDAI vaults be incentivized given they are not receiving subDAO token farming rewards, and under most designs, Maker keeps the staking revenue from the underlying liquid staking tokens?  Clarity Around Phases Please try to provide clear explanations of phases such that we can more effectively communicate and spread information.  At one point we had many phases, and it was reasonably clear what happened in which phase. But this has been simplified with the introduction of the Constitution. Not a problem that its changed, but at this point I don’t think the phases and their contents are written down anywhere. This is a problem because whenever information is communicated about the endgame plan, it is extremely difficult to determine to which phase it belongs. This creates confusion and makes it extremely hard to document. Impossible to know what’s supposed to be in place for which phase.  Collaboration In a general sense, this process of implementing endgame can be more collaborative.  If you can provide clear expectations of what is being discussed when (in advance), then you create the opportunity for collaboration around it. If you can provide a written version of what you want to discuss in advance, you give people the chance to read it, think about it, and come to the discussion with useful input. If you can delegate ‘edit access’ more explicitly, then you can improve the rate at which improvements happen. Stuff like: “I know this scope needs work, I would love to see proposed amendments for cycle x.” If you can focus attention more intentionally and narrowly on a specific topic at a given time, that may invite more useful input.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal
3rd party or author wants to collaborate on proposal
None of the topics listed match
